subject: Public Speaking
title: Butterflies: The Gut-Brain Connection
description: A micro-lesson that makes Butterflies: The Gut-Brain Connection usable.

hook.text: That churning feeling in your stomach before a speech? It's your gut's nervous system responding to your brain's alarm.

buildup.text: The gut has 500 million neurons â€” its own nervous system. It reacts to stress signals from the brain almost instantly.

discovery.text: Adrenaline reduces blood flow to digestion and increases gut motility. That's the churning, nausea, and urgency.

twist.text: Athletes report identical gut symptoms before competition. The sensation is the same whether you're scared or excited.

climax.text: Butterflies aren't a sign something is wrong. They're a sign your body is mobilizing energy for a demanding task.

punchline.text: Butterflies mean your body is showing up. Let them fly.

quiz.question: What causes 'butterflies' in the stomach before speaking?
options: The gut's nervous system reacting to brain stress signals
